alert.note: Alert for Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 7:49PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following county, Tyler. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 746 PM EST, The automated gauge on Middle Island Creek near Middlebourne reported a stage of 17.63 feet. At stages of 16 feet, low and poor drainage areas along the creek and tributaries. - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Despite the transition to freezing rain this evening, runoff will continue to contribute to creeks rises. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Middlebourne, Paden City, Alma and Lima. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
